name: Clapping Hands
baseMeaning: Two hands clapping together in applause.
tldr: Can mean genuine applause OR used between words for emphasis (often sarcastic).

contextMeanings.meaning: Adding emphasis between words - each clap is a word.

platformNotes.note: Very common for emphasis between words. Often signals frustration.
Used in comments for genuine praise or sarcastic emphasis.
Generally used positively - genuine applause for achievements.

generationalNotes.note: The between-words emphasis is standard - can be supportive or aggressive.
Familiar with both uses - context determines meaning.
Usually interpret as straightforward applause and congratulations.

warnings.title: Tone-dependent
warnings.description: When placed between words, often reads as condescending or frustrated rather than supportive.
